.class public auto ansi sealed ContentsResizedEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub ContentsResizedEventHandler(sender As Object, e As ContentsResizedEventArgs)
public delegate void ContentsResizedEventHandler(System::Object ^ sender, ContentsResizedEventArgs ^ e);
type ContentsResizedEventHandler = delegate of obj * ContentsResizedEventArgs -> unit

Docs.param: A that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event of a .

remarks.format: ## Remarks When you create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ContentsResizedEventHandler> delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. For more information about event-handler delegates, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).
